intro: Quadrella jamaicensis f. longifolia, commonly known as the Jamaican quadrella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. This variety is distinguished by its elongated leaves, which give it its specific epithet "longifolia."
